column6: notes
if no node layer is provided
column7: then please set use_boundary_nodes_as_activity_locations to yes. Node ids will be automatically generated from starting and ending points of a link

column6: this is the required data layer
if no zone layer is provided
column7: then please specify node_number_threshold_as_centroid to define nodes as zone centroids (without zone boundary)

column6: additional centroid layer can help us build the activity location file
additional centroid layer can help us build the activity location file that links centroid to physical nodes

column4: required when node file is provided

column6: for display only
if no TAZ id is provided
column7: then users can set node_number_threshold_as_centroid to specify node ids below a given value  as centroids for zones

column6: used only when users have signal control type already
column7: otherwise please set identify_signal_intersection to yes so that NeXTA can automatically identify signal locaitons based on speed limit and node connnectivities

column6: if from_node_id is empty
column7: then users can set identify_from_node_id_and_to_node_id_based_on_geometry to yes to automatically identify node ids based on the feature points in the shape file

column6: if to_node_id is empty
column7: then users can set identify_from_node_id_and_to_node_id_based_on_geometry to yes to automatically identify node ids based on the feature points in the shape file

column6: for display only
used for integrating sensor data
default value = 1
reserved for transit modeling
two comments here: if direction field is not available
column7: please specficy default_link_direction (oneway vs. twoway) (2) if field is available
column8: please also remember to setup direction_0_as_oneway_vs_twoway

column6: if data is available
column7: please specify length_unit; if data is not available
column8: NeXTA will calculate length assuming long/lat coordinate system. If the coordinate system is not long/lat
column9: then please first import the data
column10: and then setup the long/lat coordinates for nodes in NeXTA
column11: and finally use NeXTA->tools -> network tools -> reset link distanace based on long/lat coordinates

column6: users can specify use_default_number_of_lanes_from_link_type based on link type
users can specify use_default_lane_capacity_from_link_type based on link type
users can specify use_default_speed_limit_from_link_type based on link type
